meanings.sent1: The niggard refused to share even a small portion of his meal.
meanings.sent2: The old man was known in the village as a niggard who never contributed to any charity.
meanings.sent3: The niggard's pockets were so empty, they echoed when he walked.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a niggard when it came to forgiveness, holding onto grudges tightly.
meanings.sent5: The niggard's house was filled with cobwebs and dust, a reflection of his reluctance to spend on cleaning supplies.

meanings.definition: To be reluctant to give or spend.
meanings.sent1: She would niggard her time, always finding excuses not to help others.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to niggard their budget, leading to a decrease in employee benefits.
meanings.sent3: He would niggard his compliments, making others wonder if he ever appreciated their efforts.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to niggard its flow, as if holding back its waters from reaching the thirsty land.
meanings.sent5: The artist niggarded his colors, using only tiny amounts to create his masterpiece, afraid to waste any.
